column1: #Text=FAA orders review of Boeing 787 Dreamliners following week of incidents
#Text=Airlines Boeing 787 Dreamliner sits idle on the tarmac at Boston 's Logan International Airport following a electrical fire on board .

#Text=The United States Federal Aviation Administration ( FAA ) ordered a review Friday into the design and manufacture of the Boeing 787 Dreamliner , following five incidents in five days involving the aircraft and two Japanese airlines .

#Text=On Monday , an electrical fire broke out aboard a Japan Airlines 787 at Boston 's Logan International Airport , when a battery pack which powers the auxiliary power unit , for when the plane is on the ground , caught fire .
#Text=The fire was discovered by maintenance workers after passengers and crew disembarked following their flight from Tokyo 's Narita Airport .

#Text=The next day , a separate Japan Airlines 787 , also at Logan International Airport , heading to Tokyo , suffered a fuel leak that spilled around 40 gallons , which was spotted by the crew of the aircraft taxiing behind them .
#Text=" That Japan Air may know it , but they â€™ve got fuel or something spilling out the outboard left wing .

#Text=The FAA in a statement said  In light of a series of recent events , the FAA will conduct a comprehensive review of the Boeing 787 critical systems , including the design , manufacture and assembly .

column1: #Text=The purpose of the review is to validate the work conducted during the certification process and further ensure that the aircraft meets the FAA â€™s high level of safety .
